title: Q8 Punctuation MC
prompt: Which of these sentences is punctuated correctly?
feedback:
The correct answer is “Luminarias are small, decorative paper lanterns.” The adjectives “small” and “decorative” are both independent ideas modifying “paper lanterns.” You could say, “small and decorative paper lanterns,” but you wouldn’t say, “small, decorative, and paper lanterns.” Therefore, it’s appropriate to put a comma between “small” and “decorative.”

In the sentence “To make a luminaria; first open a brown paper lunch bag and fold the top inch,” a semicolon is incorrect. A comma is used to separate an introductory phrase from the rest of the sentence. The other two choices have unnecessary commas.
